## Context:
Two people got into a car accident at the corner today, one of the drivers was a 18 year old and the other driver a 40-year-old. The 40-year-old had been going 55mph in a 30mph zone and wasn't able to stop in time to avoid hitting the 18 year old when he came to a full stop at the stop sign.

## Question:
Who was acting recklessly?## Assistant:
 The 18-year-old driver was following the traffic rules and came to a full stop at the stop sign, which shows that he was driving responsibly. On the other hand, the 40-year-old driver was going 55mph in a 30mph zone, which is reckless and against the law. This reckless behavior ultimately caused the car accident. Therefore, based on the given information, it can be concluded that the 40-year-old driver was acting recklessly.
